story.text: In the Fall of 2018 Dayton introduced a class called the Genius Hour to all of its middle school students. In this class, they students worked in two-week sprints to explore areas of interests more deeply. They had to define a topic, then present it to the rest of the class each sprint cycle, using a presentation model called [[Inside/Outside]].

This model worked well to introduce the [[Agile Learning]] concept of [[Learning Cycles]] and helped students begin to develop new skills and confidence with teamwork, project management, and presentation.
In the 2019 Spring Term, the program was restructured as [[Genius Hour v2]] to find ways to more closely connect this new learning to content from core classes.
